timeline.bodyText: these test were wrong cause the "test" table object was injected into the real code and then mutated so the test weren't testing what they thought they were testing. Was never failing.
timeline.author: patduin

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                      .info("Alter table {}.{} to {}.{}", toTable.getDbName(), toTableName, toTable.getDbName(),
          
          
            
                      .info("Renaming table {}.{} to {}.{}", toTable.getDbName(), toTableName, toTable.getDbName(),
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: Also, shouldn't the first two arguments be the "from" values? Same in the log statement below.
replies.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: Alternatively we remove these two new log statements and just keep the one we already had.
replies.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: It's more clear when you actually read the log messages in test and when running CT.
replies.author: patduin

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                      .info("Alter table {}.{} to {}.{}", fromDatabaseName, fromTableName, fromTable.getDbName(),
          
          
            
                      .info("Renamed table {}.{} to {}.{}", fromDatabaseName, fromTableName, fromTable.getDbName(),
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText:
that's wrong, I kept the "alter" but changed to "Altering"
If you run the tests the logs read like this and are very clear:
- Renaming table old_db.old_table to new_db.new_table
- Altering table new_db.new_table to new_db.new_table_delete_me
- Altering table old_db.old_table to new_db.new_table
- Dropping table new_db.new_table_delete_me
replies.author: patduin

timeline.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText: Might be worth adding in the comment lines above the logs like we have in Cloverleaf? I find it a bit easier to follow
timeline.author: JayGreeeen

timeline.bodyText:
Worth also having String toDatabaseName = toTable.getDbName() ?
toTable.getDbName() is called quite a few times
timeline.author: JayGreeeen
